title: How to Turn off Automatic Update Apps in Windows 10

steps.title: Open the Microsoft Store.
steps.content: Open the Microsoft Store. Click on the Start menu and type "microsoft store" into the search bar. Click Microsoft Store in the search results. This method stop Windows apps you've installed from the Microsoft Store from updating automatically. Apps you've installed from other locations will not be affected.

steps.title: Click your account icon.
steps.content: Click your account icon. This is the person icon in the top-right corner, next to the search field. A drop-down menu will open. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is in the drop-down menu. A new page will open.

steps.title: Toggle off "App updates".
steps.content: Toggle off "App updates". Click the switch on the right. The switch will turn from blue (on) to grey (off). The color of the switch might be different on your PC. Automatic app updates are now disabled for the Microsoft Store. If the switch is off, updates for Windows apps are already disabled, so you don't have to change anything. You can also disable automatic updates for the Windows operating system.

steps.title: Open your Settings.
steps.content: Open your Settings. Click the Start menu, and then click the cog icon. The Settings window will open. While you can't permanently disable system updates , you can pause them for a certain amount of time. This is helpful if you need to use your device and don't have time to update it.

steps.title: Click Update & Security.
steps.content: Click Update & Security . You can find this towards the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Advanced options.
steps.content: Click Advanced options . This is below View update history .

steps.title: Click the "Select date" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Select date" drop-down menu. You can find this underneath the Pause updates header.

steps.title: Select a date to resume updates.
steps.content: Select a date to resume updates. You can select a date about a month away. However, it's recommended to keep automatic updates enabled as it provides important security fixes for Windows.

steps.title: Resume updates (optional).
steps.content: Resume updates (optional). If you need to undo the pause, open the Windows Update page again, and then click Resume updates at the top. Windows will immediately look for new updates to download.

steps.title: Open your Settings.
steps.content: Open your Settings. Click the Start menu, and then click the cog icon. The Settings window will open. If you keep receiving automatic updates, you can uninstall the app instead.

steps.title: Click Apps.
steps.content: Click Apps . This option should be towards the top.

steps.title: Click Apps & features.
steps.content: Click Apps & features . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click the app you want to uninstall.
steps.content: Click the app you want to uninstall. More options will appear.

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . This is on the right side.

steps.title: Click Uninstall again.
steps.content: Click Uninstall again. The app will be removed from your device. Alternatively, right-click the app in the Start menu and click Uninstall .

steps.title: Should I disable automatic updates?
steps.content: Should I disable automatic updates? When it comes to Microsoft Store apps, automatic updates can make sure they're running properly with fewer crashes. However, you may not use certain Microsoft Store apps often, so disabling it can save you some time. When it comes to Windows system updates, it's not recommended to disable automatic updates since these provide important fixes that keep your computer or laptop secure. If there's a security breach somewhere, you may be at risk by running an older version of Windows.

steps.title: Why am I still getting automatic updates?
steps.content: Why am I still getting automatic updates? If you're logged into an account in the Microsoft Store, the settings may be synced with your account. Make sure you're on the same account. If you're logged out, you may need to disable the setting again.

steps.title: How do I delete apps?
steps.content: How do I delete apps? If you want to delete Microsoft Store apps, open Settings > Apps > Apps & Features . Click the app you want to uninstall, and then click Uninstall twice. Some apps may require you to restart your computer to finish uninstalling.

steps.title: How do I download apps from the Microsoft Store?
steps.content: How do I download apps from the Microsoft Store? There are free and paid apps in the Microsoft Store. To start downloading, open the Microsoft Store app. You can browse the home page for a game, click a category on the left side, or type keywords into the search bar. Once you find an app, click it. If it's free, you'll click Get . If it's paid, you'll click the price. You must have a valid payment method added to your Microsoft account to finalize the purchase and download the app. Be sure to log into your account if you haven't already done so.
